website_summaries.verdict: Works with high pressure and delivers high performance results.
pros: A cut above the competition, this unit does the dirty work, removing paint, rust, and more
Reportedly easy to assemble and great for both small jobs and cleaning heavy equipment
Despite the prices, still appreciated for its value
cons: We wish the unit came with a lid

customer_reviews.title: Great Blaster
customer_reviews.text: Would have gotten 5 stars if it wasn't missing the axle for the tires. Used with quickrete play sand and it worked great. Not a single clog.
customer_reviews.author: Stancel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect - easy to use. The product did arrive missing a piece, but the company immediately sent out the part as soon as we called them. My son and husband are having a great time blasting everything they can find with rust on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: You better have a big air compressor . . .
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10 gallon air compressor, so this thing is starved for air and therefore doesn't work the greatest. I can use it for blasting small parts, but for something like a body panel of a hotrod, its not going to work unless you have 80+ gallon air compressor. This thing is thirsty!
customer_reviews.author: IRQVET

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate if you’re thinking of one purchase this one
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if they recommend using play sand or not from a big box store but oh my God it works awesome and I have my pressure set at 130psi Material under five bucks a bag you can’t go wrong! works very very well!
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Great sand blaster
customer_reviews.text: Love this sandblaster. Using it to blast a 39 Chevy Sedan I am restoring. Not the fastest way but great for my DIY project. I have an 80 gallon 5hp Ingersoll shop compressor running it and a air feed blasting hood. I use fine black diamond blasting media from Tractor supply. It’s only $10 per 50 LB bag.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Accurate description
customer_reviews.text: Beats buying a whole blasting cabinet. It works about as well as you might expect it to, and it's messy, but it gets the job done. I use it to blast old rusted chrome from vintage bike parts in preparation for painting.
customer_reviews.author: Apicius

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for the price. Not a heavy duty sandblaster so didn't expect much from it for $119 total. Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I had hope for. Media blasted truck chassis with #80 Garnet and worked great. Streamed two low volume compressors and wait time for pressure to build was negligible. Use a drying method for the air. Fabricated filter screen to recycle media.
customer_reviews.author: mikey

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to assemble. Didn't have to look at Manual at all. I was expecting it to be a bit heavier but I think it will be OK. I will post another review once I have used it.
customer_reviews.author: James Ely

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Easy assembly, great portability and works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... large piece of rusty equipment and it did just fine. You need a big compressor though
customer_reviews.text: I used this clean up a fairly large piece of rusty equipment and it did just fine. You need a big compressor though.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Gun arrived with a straight thread, flared (hydraulic) hose connection
customer_reviews.text: Have not been able to use it yet. Trying to find an adapter for the fitting that came with the gun. It has straight threads on both ends, with what appears to be a flared (hydraulic) straight thread on the hose side. Almost every air tool/compressor set up uses tapered NPT threads. Dumb!
customer_reviews.author: Loren Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everything
customer_reviews.text: We used fine grit walnut shells on various wood to remove old finish. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have used this blaster for a few months and no issues. Using quickcrete play sand which is nice, only 4.50 for a 50 lbs at lowes and they store it inside so it's nice and dry. Would definitely recommend this blaster. I'm blasting allot truck parts and they are ready for paint.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shinn

customer_reviews.title: Good Performance for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup to my cabinet blaster for large and unwieldy parts that wouldn't come close to fitting in. The overall fit and finish is better than I had expected from the price, and the Instructions are straight-forward. Performance is great as long as you keep clean air, clean sand, and plenty of CFM.
customer_reviews.author: Chance W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't my first media blaster but for as inexpensive as it is probably my favorite. Well made and works perfectly. I've been using the black magic media from Tractor Supply.
customer_reviews.author: Arachnid

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Completed sanding of frame off resto of my Dads 1936 John Deere B unstyled, finished project
customer_reviews.author: Rajabob

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad there's Internet to help us all out
customer_reviews.text: Instructions missing diagram. If it says as shown in diagram below then there should be a diagram below. Hello... Mcfly... Also 75% of manual is warnings. Some room for improvement that's for sure. I'm glad there's Internet to help us all out.
customer_reviews.author: SIXM6N

customer_reviews.title: the order came in quickly and undamaged so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, the order came in quickly and undamaged so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I received my blaster damaged an bent an two of ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my blaster damaged an bent an two of the screws were not made right making it impossible to assemble had to purchase new hardware just to get my project done in time not very happy
customer_reviews.author: Russell Harper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this product yet but it's built well
customer_reviews.author: Cburd

product_meta.title: Black Bull SFSB90 90 Pound Gravity Feed Abrasive Blaster
product_meta.description: Remove oxidation, paint and rust with the Black Bull 90 Lb Gravity Feed Abrasive Blaster. Designed for contractors and serious do-it-yourselfers, this steel sandblaster is an easy way for you to clean a variety of different surfaces including metal, wood, brick or concrete. This siphon feed sandblaster with steel hopper features a 90 lb capacity for approximately 150 minutes of blast time. A long 8 foot blast hose lets you get into out of the way and hard to reach places.
feature_bullets: Includes 4 ceramic nozzles, 8 foot x 3/8 inch blasting hose, pistol grip blast gun, and protective hood
Heavy-duty all steel construction, Gravity feed design, 7.5 gal. tank size , 90 poundscapacity
Maximum working pressure: 120 psi, Air consumption: 7CFM @ 80 psi, Use 80 grit or smaller diameter abrasive
10 inch rubber wheels; overall size: 16 inch L x 18 inch W x 36 inch T; weighs 20 pounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars56 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
